Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a member of a coast guard 海岸警卫队队员
motion or operation 航行中；工作中
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The nationwide medical reform is now under way.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   硬纸盒，纸板箱
n.   炸弹
vt.  line or stuff with soft material 用软的材料衬垫
n.    a frame for holding bombs; a framework or stand on or in which articles are placed 炮弹架；架
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Put these tools back in the rack.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.   on land; to the shore  在岸上；向岸边
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Pull the boat ashore!

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  of or in accordance with tradition 传统的，惯例的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There are also people who come to take such courses as Chinese traditional medicine, painting, calligraphy and photography.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    火鸡
remove (sth.) to a place where it is usually stored 把……收起，放好
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The kids are asked to put all the toys away before they leave.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.     the time of sunset 日落时分
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The fighting broke out about two hours after sundown.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    后甲板
n.   a current of air; the amount taken in by a single act of drinking or inhaling 气流；一次吸入（或饮入）的量 e.g.  He took a draught of beer.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: begin to give serious attention to or deal with 开始认真思考（或做） e.g.  Recently I've got to wondering why I am doing the part-time job.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.      玉米穗轴
and so on 等等 e.g.  The patient can have apples, apple juice, apple sauce, and the rest.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: seeking 寻求，探求 quest  n.  the act of seeking or pursuing sth. 寻求，追求 e.g.  Tony went to the school library in quest of Mark Twain's novels.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    turn around to the opposite direction; exchange the positions of 反转；交换……的位置 e.g.  They have made it clear that they will not reverse the decision to increase prices.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   spoken; of or connected with a verb 口头的；动词的，跟动词有关的 e.g.  We have a verbal agreement with her.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: think about, consider 考虑；思考 e.g.  Even when she didn't say anything you could see her turning things over in her mind.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  make or become bright or brighter （使）变亮，（使）变得更亮 e.g.  His face brightened up when he was told to have won the first prize.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    pay back, reward 偿还，报答 e.g.  Peter's previous work with us has played an important role in our success, and we will repay him for his efforts some day.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  not pretending, honest 诚挚的，真诚的 e.g.  To any readers who feel annoyed please accept my sincere apologies.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.   for a long time without any stop 长久地
n.    being thankful, thankfulness 感激，谢意
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I should like to express my gratitude to all members of the laboratory past and present for their contribution to the breakthrough.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   sth. that is said, esp. formally and officially 陈述；声明
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The trade union issued a statement opposing racial discrimination.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  deeply or sincerely felt 衷心的，由衷的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She gave him her heartfelt thanks.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    an expression of gratitude; understanding of the qualities or worth of sth. 感谢；欣赏
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We offer this small token by way of appreciation.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   of or relating to agriculture 农业的，农艺的
a.  of or relating to machines or mechanics 机械的，机械学的
n.   the town or city of one's birth, rearing or main residence 故乡，家乡
a.    （对牧师的尊称，与the连用）尊敬的
during a ship's voyage on the sea 在海上航行
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The boats remained at sea for an average of ten days at a time.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  relating to one thing and not others; particular 明确的；具体的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The new system made it easier for employers to recruit workers based on specific needs.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   interest, benefit 利益，好处 on sb.'s behalf/on the behalf of sb.    for sb.; in the interests of sb.; as the representative of sb.  为（某人），为了（某人）的利益；代表（某人）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  On the behalf of my parents, I would like to express my gratitude to you for your help.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a single fact, event, etc., expressing a general idea 实例，例子
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There are many instances of good people and good deeds nowadays.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  highest in place or rank, predominant 最高的，突出的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The development of national economy appears to be the uppermost in people's minds.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  make the importance of (sth.) very clear  to sb.; cause (sb.) to feel admiration or respect 使重视；使留下深刻印象
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I don't think his mother was very impressed by our behavior in the restaurant.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   the period of being a boy 少年时代
n.     a short oral or written test 测验
v.   make or become smaller or less （使）变小，（使）减少
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Her patience with the children diminished as the hours went by.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    leave uncovered; make accessible to 使暴露，使接触 be exposed to 暴露于；与……接触
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The soldiers were exposed to considerable danger.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   cover completely in a liquid; absorb deeply 使浸没；使沉迷 be immersed in  沉浸在；沉迷于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I held my breath and completely immersed myself in the water, trying to stay under for as long as possible.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   察觉，意识
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There has been an increasing awareness that many people are affected by crime.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   causing wonder, excellent 不可思议的，美妙的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I have got some marvelous news for you -- you're going to be promoted.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    祈祷，祷告
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She says her prayers before she gets into bed.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   bring or call together into a group; fit together the parts or pieces of 集合；装配
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The members of the tour group assembled at the airport for departure.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  thoughtful of the rights and feelings of others; marked by careful thought 体贴的；考虑周到的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Friendly and considerate, he invariably consults with people around him before taking decisions.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   scatter (drops or particles of sth.) on (sth.); scatter in small drops 将……洒在……上；洒
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Sprinkle the meat with salt and place it in the pan.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    a pleasant dreamy or romantic feeling 梦幻
v.   remove (the load or cargo) from a ship, car, etc.; remove the load or cargo from (a ship, car, etc.)  卸（货）；将货从（车、船等）上卸下
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Unload everything from the boat and clean it thoroughly.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    （车、船、飞机等所载的）货物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The ship called at the port to load its regular cargo of bananas.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    load again 再装
vi.   become fainter; move back or away from a point 变得模糊；退去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  With the passage of time, my unhappy memories of the place receded.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  assemble at a prearranged time and place （在预定的时间和地点）会合  n.  a prearranged meeting 约会，会面
vt.    cause to conform; grant 使符合；给予
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The headmaster accorded me permission to attend the seminar.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  highest, uppermost 最高的，顶端的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  the topmost branches of a giant tree

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  扩音器，喇叭
v.   发出（刺耳的声音）；锉，刮
a.  somewhat more than a hundred 一百多个 odd  a.  a little more than; that cannot be divided by two; strange 稍多于；单数的；奇怪的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He has now appeared in sixty odd films.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a sailor serving on the same ship as another 同船水手
n.   甲板
vi.    form a close group around 群集 n.  群，簇，丛
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The boys and girls clustered together round the camp fire telling stories and singing songs.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a sailor on a ship 海员，水手，水兵
v.   (cause to) curve outward （使）鼓胀
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His pocket was bulging with sweets.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.     the amount that a fist can hold 一把
v.   utter in a loud, harsh voice; (of dogs, etc.) make a sharp harsh sound 厉声叫出；（狗等）吠叫
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Newsboys will be found barking their wares on the front steps.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  following one after the other 接连不断的，连续的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  After four successive election defeats, the Labour Party once again faces the painful task of reconstruction.

Vocabularies.Definition: one by one 挨个地，轮流地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The freshmen called out their names in turn.

Vocabularies.Definition: prep.   in the middle of, among 在……当中，在……之间
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Children were changing classrooms amid laughter and shouts.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    make humble 使谦卑，使卑下
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I see no point in humbling myself before my creditors.

Vocabularies.Definition: (underwent, undergone) vt. go through, experience 经过，经历
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  No one can force you to undergo a medical examination.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  rapid, prompt 迅疾的，即时的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Because of the swift, enormous growth of the urban areas many farmers leave their villages to go to cities where there is work.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   放心，确信
vt.    recognize the quality or significance of, value 赏识，重视
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Professor Smith's general comments may help students to appreciate the theories in the textbook.

Vocabularies.Definition: cause to return to the mind 回想起
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The old photographs brought back many pleasant memories of my college life.

Vocabularies.Definition: instantly 一瞬间
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The answer to the math question came to him in a flash.

Vocabularies.Definition: (wept) v.  shed (tears), cry because of 流（泪），（为……而）哭泣
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She lost control of her feelings and began to weep.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   尿布   vt.  put a diaper on 给……衬尿布
n.    a living thing, esp. a person 生命，人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  People expect a horse to perform like a car, with no thought for its feelings as a living being.

Vocabularies.Definition: behave; keep busy doing (sth.) ; set about  表现；忙于；着手
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's unprofessional to go about criticizing your colleagues.

Vocabularies.Definition: secretly 秘密地，暗自
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The negotiators were meeting in secret for several months before the peace agreement was reached.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    repeat or copy the words of (another) 引用，引述
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  To close, I would like to quote Benjamin Franklin, "One should eat to live, not live to eat."

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.    to a great degree, very much 在很大程度上，非常
a.   of chief concern or importance 最主要的，最重要的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This duty is paramount to all the others.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   writing paper and envelopes, writing materials and office supplies 信纸信封；文具

Vocabularies.Word: Alex Haley     亚历克斯·黑利
USS ＝ United States Ship 美国军舰
Murzim     军市一（军舰名，原为星名）
Tulagi      图拉吉岛(位于所罗门群岛南部的岛屿)
Thanksgiving      (Day) 感恩节 (美国节日，指每年11月的第4个星期四)
Pilgrim       （移居美洲的）英国清教徒
Simon      A. Haley   西蒙·黑利
Pine Bluff      派恩布拉夫（美国地名）
Cynthia Palmer      辛西娅·帕尔默
the Rev. Lonual Nelson      洛纽尔·纳尔逊牧师
Pete      皮特 (Peter的昵称，耶稣十二门徒之一)
